result.execSummary:
The defendant Diamond J. Haywood-Ashford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: GFE to maintain FTE/schooling or combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 hours community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed and only within prescribed amounts.  

No contact with L.L. or residence of L.L.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended.  AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
21CM1162:
Ct. 1 (DC)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Alcohol and Controlled Substances unless prescribed and only within the prescribed amounts, Good Faith Effort to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, No Contact with L.L. or the residence of L.L., Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge. Court finds 4 days credit.

Ct. 3 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling)>> Sentence W/H- 2 Years Probation, Concurrent.
